reviews.sentence: CANT beat the PRICE. Awesome Stay. Yes the rooms are outdated but very clean. Yes the bed is hard but it was not a huge problem especially for the price. The room was very clean and staff is very attentive to ones needs. And they have the Best Barbecue restraint on the premises of the hotel. The food was so Delicious you wo nt regret eating there. The price is jus Right. more comfortable Beds. The Hotels Bar B cue is just Delicious.

Great value for long weekend getaway. Long weekend getaway just to relax. it is location is great two pool areas are great staff is great and rooms were very comfortable clean and efficient. We love staying here. A GREAT value.
comfortable. Coffee was cold and the spa did not do pedicure the side of the hotel had a bunch of junk looked dirty. Hotel itself was comfortable and clean.

Rooms not very clean beds are hard as a rock and water leaks from the ceiling. I bought the groupon deal and hoped for the best. I was greeted by a very nice man at the registration desk who pleasantly checked us in early. Room was supposed to come with free WIFI but it constantly went down. WIFI is crap. When I got to the room it looked decent but the bathroom was not very clean. There was a wad of hair on the floor and baseboards looked like they have not been cleaned in years. I do not exactly have high standards for cleanliness but this was gross for even me. The beds are so uncomfortable. It feels like a thin pilowtop on a concrete bed. it is so hard. Who wants to sleep on a thin pillow over concreteIn the bathroom water dripped from the ceiling light from the floor above. This freaked us out as we thought the whole ceiling could collapse if a tub above was overflowing. When we called to report this the front desk offered to change our room. However did not care if the water was overflowing because there was no maintenance person available. So in our California drought did not care if water was continuously running or if it damaged their hotel because they just did not care. I would not stay here again. Groupon is exactly what you pay for a cheap deal for a place you would never stay at normally.
BUYER BEWARE. Great location. dual access on both streets. free parking. courteous helpful staff. Outdated decor thread bare carpet. no hot water had to request the hot water be turned on.

Great Pool for Swimming Laps. Wonderful big pool. I was able to swim laps. Nice breakfast. Excellent value overall. Staff was pleasant. Beds were comfortable. Towels were very rough. Poor bathroom lighting design there was no separate light in the bathroom only. The light lit up both the bathroom and the sink area. In the middle of the night this light disturbed others in the room. There were few electrical outlets. The hair dryer holder was not securely fastened to the wall. The window covering shutters did not keep the light out in the morning.
Had av great time. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location was great.

Good. Easy access. Close to pool. Clean bathroom. Needed some painting especially along baseboard. Appeared I kept under bathroom vanity. Not clean behind furniture. Could be kept better. Breakfast was ok too many starches for my taste. Coffee just ok.
Excellent. Beautiful resort very quiet and clean personal was friendly. everything was good.

Great Place to Chill after the Road Trip. Booked a 2 night stay at the end of our Highway 1 road trip and immediately found ourselves chilling by the nice really warm pool. This was heaven after thousands of miles driving and the 2 nights soon turned into 4. Ok its a little outside of Palm Sprigs town itself but an Uber cost 8 or so. The guys on reception were very helpful especially Real great name and the room was very clean the 1st room had a bad Wi Fi reception so we were moved without and fuss. Nice buffet style breakfast and all day coffee. Those wanting a cooked breakfast can get one at Ricks across the road. The Pool and gardens were also very clean OK the leaf blower was noisy but he was doing his job.

Great value for the price and quite comfortable. Great location. Breakfast was fresh plentiful and well served. Loved the hot tubs and pools. Good parking. Clean and comfortable. Since the windows do not open in the first floor rooms we were dependent on the a c fan system which did not work as well as we would have liked. It was either stuffy too warm or too cold. All else about the room was fine.

Distributive. It was horrible. A loud emergency alarm came on at 3 am. It woke me up and gave me an anxiety and beeped about another 3 times. Now me and the neighbors ca n’t sleep. I want a refundIt was horrible. A loud emergency alarm came on at 3 am. It woke me up and gave me an anxiety and beeped about another 3 times. Now me and the neighbors ca n’t sleep. I want a refund.

We do NOT recommend this facility. Air conditioning temperature reached 100 during our stay. and hair dryer were both broken and had to be repaired or replaced. Room was shabby had not been updated for many years. They overcharged for three nights when we stayed two forcing us to report the overcharge to American Express.
What I liked was how friendly staff is however the rooms itself are older. Hard to get electricity to work but it got what needed to be done which was a hotel room for the weekend.
Fair. The air from the aircondition smelled bad. The bed was hard.
Disappointing. The staff was kind. It was dirty old falling apart and just DIRTY. Oh did I already say it was DIRTY. Breakfast is included however basically it ’s only cereal that ’s available.

Regardless of any marketing or advertising you might have seen regarding this place being upscale or remodeled this place is equivalent to an lower average Motel 6 with a good location. Do not expect any amenities beyond a pool coffee in the office. Steer clear of this place during a music festival spring break or holiday. The place attracts a younger louder crowd because it is price range location. Otherwise the Ivey Palm is fine if you are only looking for just a room. It is not a spa resort or destination. Know before you go.

Charged for room manager said would be reversed Was told by manager David that it was ok to cancel reservation due to me not seeing any note about a security depositand no penalty of any kind. I had my wallet stolen that morning and used a hotels dot com gift card to book room. I then went on with the night feeling secure i would not be charged and tbe giftcard would be restored. If not i would have come up with the deposit even if i had to borrow it vslosing the whole room charge. Fast forward 2 days and i see the charge was not reversed and i call the ivy resort back and there is a note tbey wo nt reverse because the deposit is stated on the web. Yet other manager of the day stated they would. This hotel stay was so needed and such a gift my daughter had purchased for me as i had been sick in the hospital for 10 days previous. This is nt anything they will lose sleep over yet is having a huge impact on me. I will call the general manager tomorrow Lois and delete this when resolved if resolved or they agree to give me a nights hotel stayim just an older guy that had lots of health problems looking forward to peace and quiet yet getting a cold shoulder. Hopefully they will be human and do a right thing and help me. Stay tuned.

For the price I paid the all amenities were as expected. However I would not stay here again and would not recommend it to family or friends. My room was broken into and some of my belongings were stolen while I was out one day and the staff were not very helpful with this issue. After this incident I did not feel safe during the rest of my stay.

The rooms were clean. If you are just going there to stay for a night or two and just using the room to sleep then it ’s okay. Kids could not enjoy much in the open swimming pool as well. The spa jacuzi was under construction. Wish we had known this then we had made the reservation. Not sure why this is called a resort and spa. Nothing great for the price we paid for room per night.
